intro: Sisyrinchium bakeri, commonly known as the Baker's blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and small, showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, such as desert foothills and open woodlands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
